comments.post_title: Nissan surges on report Japan group may seek Tesla investment
comments.comment_body:
It's all about branding for each demographic.Â  Cheaper cars bring volume, and done correctly can be very profitable, great revenue, and are a hedge in an economic downturn.Â  Honda can keep the higher range models for mature adults.Â  Above them is Acura, and below them would be something like Nissan going after younger folks with little/no credit.Â Â 


This is nothing new.Â  It also alleviates the consumer "growing out of" your brand while still being able to capture them young.


It's not like Honda is in a hot bidding war to buy Nissan's secret sauce of every way not to make a CVT.Â  They're potentially buying a market segment, not technical prowess.

comments.post_title: Nissan surges on report Japan group may seek Tesla investment
comments.comment_body: Honda already has a great entry option in non-US markets, the Honda City, as well as the Honda HR-V (do they even sell that in the USA?). They could bring that over if cash is the problem. I own a City, I could've gotten a Civic or CR-V but why would I spend that much when I don't need it.

comments.post_title: Nissan surges on report Japan group may seek Tesla investment
comments.comment_body:
Yes, but they're Hondas.Â  Again, it's not the technical ability to make a car that has value.Â  Having distinct tiered brands with different markets to target does.Â  It's why McDonald's, despite owning a huge chunk of Chipotle, never branded themselves as McMexican or whatever, despite the product being very well liked.Â  It's why Luxottica could save SO MUCH by just branding everything Luxottica, or take a higher brand name like their Prada line and slap it on the cheaper brands, but they don't.Â  They don't hate savings.Â  They understand branding and demographics


Young kids rarely want to buy the same brand their parents do.Â  From an advertising side, an ad campaign aimed at getting middle aged folks to see Honda as a reliable value is going to hurt an ad campaign aimed at showing the Honda City as young, hip, yet unique.Â Â 


They do sell the HR-V in the US.
